text:
The best seafood out there. A bit price, but they sure know how to turn bland tasting seafood into amazing delicacies. Service is slow, but worth it. Definitely recommend the fried octopus, dont be afraid, its a real treat.

L. John Dory
Twitter: @LJohnDory

What a hidden gem! Fresh seafood selection cooked to perfection. We ordered: grilled tiger prawn, mussels (cooked with tomato sauce), grilled octopus and lemon rice. Everything tastes amazing, the seasoning is not over powering - just perfect. The price is very affordable for the quality of food that they serve. Tips is optional and that is the more reason I give big tips and would definitely comeback for more. Highly recommended.

Service très rapide et courtois. On choisit les fruits de mer ou les poissons qui sont sur la glace et les chefs cuisinent les plats. 

On a mangé des calmars frits, pieuvres sautés, crevettes, patates frites, légumes grillés, morues frites et aubergines farcies.

Le seul hic est qu'une tentacule de pieuvre n'était pas frais. Le reste était bien. 

On aime beaucoup les fruits de mer, alors c'est un restaurant sympathique. 

100$ (taxes et pourboires inclus) pour 6 adultes.

J'ai adoré cet endroit!!!! C'était tellement bon! Le concept: C'est une poissonnerie, où on choisi ce qu'on veut manger et ils nous cuit cela sur place, grillé, frit, avec sauces etc. Le calmar frit et les crevettes Tigers sont délicieuses. Prochaine fois, je vais essayer les crevettes avec beurre et ail..! Un gros  aux patates, elles sont délicieuses. J'ai goûter la salade maison, fish and chip, pieuvre et c'est tout je crois. C'était assez haha! 

Ah oui, malgré que le riz du Moyen-Orient est délicieux, ici il était fade. Je vous le déconseille. Demandez de la sauce tartare, très bonne. 

Des étoiles de moins, pour le service..ils ne sont pas venu nous voir, il fallait demander constamment des trucs, de l'eau de la sauce ou autre boisson.

Attention, il n'y a pas d'alcool. C'est un resto musulman et c'est Haram. Mais ce n'est pas pour cela que j'enlève des étoiles :) Je retournerai très vite. À 3 personnes avec tout ce que nous avons manger un gros 99$, soit 33$ par personnes avec une dizaines de crevettes tiger! Miam

Wonderful fish.  Delicious rare spices.  We had the Salmon. Huge servings. Vegetables and salads alacarte. No liquor served.  Calamari served fried and very tasty.    Fish market adjoining the dining room
Very unique for Montreal.  Soft drinks available.  Food served family style.
L'endroit est bien pour emporter et la nourriture est bonne mais pour manger sur place est limiter. Tout est frais du jour.

I came here because I tried the one in Côte-des-Neiges and was already a fan. 
One of my really good friend is muslim, so eating seafood was a really good idea too. We then brought my parents here because they are seafood fans !! 

For those who never tried any of the Rayan, it's like a seafood market for real, where you can see the fresh seafood and buy it to go home. 
However, if you add in a few dollars per pound, they will cook it for you.

They seem to use pretty much the same spices on everything, which is really really tasty and a bit salty. 

We loved : fried calmari, the fries (oh my gosh !!), the octopus if it was well cooked (there were 1-2 pieces that were not as fresh ... ), the whole fish cooked (35$ for the whole fish, but my parents were delighted), the huge salad ! And the grilled veggies is a must !!! 

We liked but not sure we will re-order : the mussels (the 2nd time we had it, 2 people of the party had diarrhea ...)

It cost about 60$ for 3, and 100$ for 4 (including the whole fish).

I will definitely go back.
This is a good restaurant for a group, definitely do not go alone !! 3-4 are good parties. 
They were open on a Monday night.
No alcohol served nor permitted.
